Entries.Resort: The mushrooms around here are extraordinary!$h#$b#I have never seen any mushrooms like these!$h
Entries.Resort_Pier_2: Some of the largest organisms in the ocean eat plankton.#$b#Can you believe it, @? Both blue whales and basking sharks live off of plankton!
Entries.19_2: I'd love to study some of those magma caps found on Ginger Island some day. I can't believe the conditions these mushrooms can survive!%revealtasteDemetrius851

Entries.Demetrius: Rare to see winter storms around here....Something in the weather seems different.

Entries.Resort_Pier: Look, @, a mola mola!#$b#Despite their odd appearance, they're actually quite new to the seas, evolving only about seventy million years ago!
Entries.ScienceHouse_22_20: I've got so much data I need to analyze.$s
Entries.fallScienceHouse_22_20: I'd love to talk, @, but I have a grant submission coming up that I need to work on.
Entries.summerScienceHouse_22_20: I have so many measurements I need to make today...$s
Entries.fallMountain_45_8: We're lucky to have so much old growth forest around here.#$b#It takes decades for a forest to develop properly.
Entries.summer_2{{YearRemainder}}: I better not forget our anniversary this year, Robin will really hate it if I forget again.
Entries.Mon10: Mmmm, there's nothing like a nice fresh strawberry in spring, right?[400]$h
Entries.Tue10: I love how the valley comes alive in spring.$h
Entries.summer_Mon10: Hmmm, what should I cook today?
Entries.summer_Tue10: It's so, so hot in town, but it's lovely and cool in the mountains...$h
Entries.fall_Mon10: Argh, so much vacuuming to do...$s
Entries.fall_Tue10: I wish the house would clean itself sometimes...
Entries.winter_Mon10: I don't tend to do much fieldwork in winter, because everything goes dormant.
Entries.winter_Tue10: I have so much mopping I need to do.$s
Entries.3{{YearRemainder}}: Joja dumped a lot of trash into the waters around here back when they were operating that mine.#$b#We're still fishing trash out of the river.
Entries.4{{YearRemainder}}: Mining can cause quite a bit of ecological damage if not carried out carefully.#$b#Joja let quite a few dangerous chemicals leak more than a few times.
Entries.7{{YearRemainder}}: The mines...Joja was mostly in it for the coal, I think.#$b$So was Accel before them.
Entries.8{{YearRemainder}}: Burning coal is pretty terrible for the environment.#$b#Sulfur compounds in the coal make acid rain, which greatly weakens the trees.
Entries.9{{YearRemainder}}: Up to the north lives a species of shark that lives for hundreds of years.#$b#It has an insanely slow metabolism, so it seems like time itself is stretched out for these animals!
Entries.10{{YearRemainder}}: @, have you ever considered cultivating mushrooms?

Entries.1_2: @, did you know that banana trees aren't actually trees, but rather a monocot?#$b#Amazing what they can do despite not having lignin!
Entries.2_2: Caffeine is actually highly toxic against insects!#$b#But it doesn't make a good agricultural insecticide, it decays in sunlight.
Entries.3_2: Lignin is really an amazing structural protein, and is why trees can grow to the heights they do.
Entries.6_2: I hope my collaborator can get his edits in soon....$s
Entries.7_2: %Demetrius looks exhausted.#$b#*Yawn*. Sorry, @, I was up all night attempting to get my typesetting software to put figure one on page one.$s
Entries.16_2: It's always reviewer two, isn't it? Always.$a
Entries.18_2: Gotta order more reagents soon, we're running low on HCl.
Entries.19_2: Maru was helping me with minipreps the other day. Lab work is so much more fun when you're working with someone.$h
Entries.20_2: Sometimes I go down to the beach to collect shells.#$b#There's no real scientific reason to do so, they're just pretty.#$e#$c .2#Here, I found this one the other day.[394 393]#Summer, especially, a lot of shells wash up.#
Entries.21_2: I made some extra coffee this morning. Here, have some![395]$h
Entries.22_2: Robin is usually pretty practical, but she does like some frilly things sometimes...
Entries.fall_Thu10: In fall, we get so many common mushrooms fruiting. They're quite tasty![404]$h
Entries.winter_Mon10: I'd love to take a trip on that submarine some day...
Entries.ScienceHouse_27_9: Let's see, what should I cook...what ingredients do I have...
Entries.ScienceHouse_22_20: I'm so sorry, @, I've got so much work I need to get done before next Monday.
Entries.summerScienceHouse_22_20: Just need to gather a little more data for a proposal.
Entries.fallScienceHouse_22_20: Sometimes I feel like I spend more time writing proposals than anything else.$s
Entries.winterScienceHouse_22_20: Sorry, @, I've got a talk I need to prepare for.
Entries.fallMountain_45_8: Some of these trees are more than a hundred years old. I hope you weren't planning on cutting them down.

Entries.fall_1_2: Now that it's fall, I think I'll try growing some pumpkins for Robin again.%revealtasteRobin276#$b#They're her favorite vegetable. Here, I have a few extra seeds, want them? [490]#$e#Tried growing them a few years ago, I'm not the best gardener. Think I over-watered them.
Entries.6_2: Did you see that paper by the %name group out of %place University? Amazing, isn't it?$h
Entries.16_2: Sometimes I wonder what I could have done to be more successful in my career...$s
Entries.18_2: Between you and I, @, writing proposals is the worst part of my job.
Entries.20_2: Tree fertilizer can make trees grow much faster, but I wonder if it affects the quality of their wood.#$b#Generally fast-growing trees can't produce as dense of wood.
Entries.22_2: Sometimes, I come across interesting artifacts.#$b#I wonder what civilizations lived here before we did?
Entries.ScienceHouse_22_20: I've got a paper I have to write, so of course all I want to do is make a blackberry cobbler and mop the entire house or something...
Entries.summerScienceHouse_22_20: It's been so hot lately, I suspect the trees are stressed.
Entries.fallScienceHouse_22_20: Got a conference coming up, @, hoping I can get myself a talk.
Entries.winterScienceHouse_22_20: My collaborator claims his equipment is broken again.#$b#We're far closer to the submission deadline for this paper than I'd like...
Entries.fallMountain_45_8: Funding has been a lot tighter this year than it was last year.#$b#I didn't even get my inflation adjustment. I'm making less actual money this year than last.$s

Entries.2_2: Before Pelican Town was a mining town, it was a forestry.#$b#But that was a long time ago, and the forest has had a bit of a chance to recover.
Entries.18_2: @, did you know that the oldest mushrooms are more than two thousand years old?
Entries.19_2: It's really weird we celebrate romantic holidays with the cut off reproductive organs of plants, isn't it?
Entries.20_2: My dad used to take us out fishing when I was very young. I was never any good, though.
Entries.21_2: There are plenty of fish that live in this mountain lake! Fish are a very important part of the ecosystem.$h
Entries.22_2: Many fish rely on swim bladders to maintain neutral buoyancy with the water, but this restricts them to only a small depth range.
Entries.23_2: Seahorses are, amazingly enough, very evolutionarily new, dating from only about thirteen million years ago.
Entries.winter_Mon10: There are only a few plants that flower during winter, but crocus is one of them.[418]
Entries.fallScienceHouse_22_20: I've got so much work I need to do...$s
Entries.winterScienceHouse_22_20: More glassware to wash, always more glassware to wash...$s
